content: the gauge above is only a suggestion your gauge may vary depending on what yarn and needles you want to use **nor bandana** is knitted top-down which means you cast on a few stitches and work the increases until you reach the desired length or run out of yarn you can knit it in stockinette or garter stitch with or without i-cord edges it can be in any size you desire small scarf bandana shawl or even a little blanket to keep you warm if you re looking for a quick project to knit for your pet this is it as well it s **a perfect scrappy project** to make space for new yarn in your stash who doesn t like it right **gauge ** any gauge **needle size ** any needle size **yarn ** any yarn or any yarn combination **techniques ** knitting flat long-tail cast on method increasing bind off method wet blocking **modification ideas ** * you can color block or use intarsia if you have a colorful idea in your head * if you want it to be a headscarf you can add i-cord strings after binding off so that you can tie a knot * you can knit this bandana in garter stitch * you can knit textured stripes - alternating knit and purl row on both right and wrong side * you can add crochet borders or i-cord edges once your bandana is finished * you can embroider anything you like in the corner or all over your project you can always use a hashtag #norbandana and tag me in your wip and fo photos - @ko atelier on instagram and youtube and @koatelier on tiktok if you have any questions or suggestions please contact me via e-mail koatelier contact@gmail com or on raverly
